text: Under this act and its subsequent extensions, the President was authorized to negotiate agreements with other countries for tariff reduction.

title: Commission on Foreign Economic Policy
text: In his message of April 7, the President called for a commission to study U.S. foreign economic policy in general.

title: Commission on Foreign Economic Policy
text: Section 301 of this Act provided for a bipartisan commission which consisted of seventeen members: seven appointed by the President, five appointed from the Senate by the Vice President, and five from the United States House of Representatives by the Speaker.

title: Commission on Foreign Economic Policy
text: President Eisenhower appointed Clarence B. Randall, Chairman of the Board of Inland Steel Company, as Chairman of the Commission.

title: Commission on Foreign Economic Policy
text: The Commission was directed to examine and report on the subjects of international trade, foreign economic policy, and the trade aspects of national security and total foreign policy.

title: Commission on Foreign Economic Policy
text: It was to recommend appropriate policies, measures, and practices, based on its findings, in a report to Congress.

title: Robert Nyce
text: Robert E. Nyce is a former Republican member of the Pennsylvania House of Representatives.

title: Robert Nyce
text: A graduate of Northampton Area Senior High School, Northampton, PA and Moravian College, Bethlehem, PA for over twenty years he was a tax professional working at Lehigh Portland Cement Company, Allentown, PA from 1970 to 1973, Manager, Credit Taxes, Insurance and Payroll at Frick Company, Waynesboro, PA from 1973 to 1975, Senior Tax Accountant for Bethlehem Steel Corporation from 1975 to 1985 and Asst. Vice President, Taxes for Chrysler First, Inc., Allentown, PA from 1985 to 1990.

title: Robert Nyce
text: He was a member of the Tax Executives Institute including Chairman of the State Tax Committee in the 1980s.

title: Robert Nyce
text: During his private sector employment, Mr. Nyce was active in his community of East Allen Township.

title: Robert Nyce
text: From 1979 to 1984 he served as a member and Chairman of the East Allen Township Municipal Authority and again from 2007 to 2013 as a member and Treasurer.

title: Robert Nyce
text: From 2011 to 2013 Mr. Nyce negotiated and helped close the sale of the East Allen Township Municipal Authority's assets to The City of Bethlehem and the Bath Borough Municipal Authority thereby ensuring high quality service of water and sewer for the future for all residents of East Allen Township.

title: Robert Nyce
text: From 1984 to 1990, Mr. Nyce served on the Northampton Area School District Board of Directors as member, Vice Chairman and Chairman.

title: Robert Nyce
text: He also served on the Bethlehem Area Vocational Technical School Joint Operating Committee as member, Vice Chairman and Chairman.

title: Robert Nyce
text: In both capacities, he was responsible for normal business operations and participated in union contract negotiations with staff.

title: Robert Nyce
text: In 1990, Mr. Nyce ran for and was elected State Representative for the 138th PA House District encompassing parts of Northampton and Monroe Counties.

title: Robert Nyce
text: During his three terms in the House of Representatives he served on several important committees: Education, Local Government, Fish and Game, Finance to name a few.

title: Robert Nyce
text: In 1996 he ran for PA Auditor General in an unsuccessful bid to represent the people of PA as their financial watchdog.

title: Robert Nyce
text: Following the campaign, he was hired as the Executive Director of the Pennsylvania Independent Regulatory Review Commission (IRRC).

title: Robert Nyce
text: Mr. Nyce served for eight years in that capacity overseeing two major revisions to the Regulatory Review Act and many significant regulatory issues facing the residents of Pennsylvania.

title: Robert Nyce
text: The PA IRRC reviews all regulations promulgated in PA and provides citizens an opportunity to comment on and affect those regulations prior to their promulgation by the state agency that authored the regulation.

title: Robert Nyce
text: The two exceptions are the PA Fish and Boat Commission and the PA Game Commission which remain outside the regulatory review process.

title: Robert Nyce
text: In 2005, Mr. Nyce retired from state government and now resides in Northampton County.

title: Robert Nyce
text: He has been a member of the Free and Accepted Masons of PA since 1971 and the Rajah Shrine, Reading, PA since the mid-ninety's.

title: Robert Nyce
text: Mr. Nyce is a past member of the Northampton Exchange Club.

title: Robert Nyce
text: Mr. Nyce served in the U.S. Army from 1966 to 1969.

title: Robert Nyce
text: Having completed his basic training at Fort Knox, Kentucky and Advanced Individual Training at Fort Lewis, Washington he was assigned to the 1st Battalion, 3rd Infantry Unit, "The Old Guard" at Arlington National Cemetery where he served for about two and one half years attaining the rank of Staff Sergeant, E-6 before taking an early release to return to Moravian College in September 1969.

title: Robert Nyce
text: While serving at Arlington, SSG Nyce participated in former President Dwight D. Eisenhower's funeral, President Nixon's Inauguration and Robert F. Kennedy's Funeral.

title: Guido Brunner
text: Guido Brunner (born 27 May 1930 in Madrid, died 2 December 1997) was a German diplomat and politician of the liberal Free Democratic Party.

title: Guido Brunner
text: He served as European Commissioner for Energy, Research and Science in the Jenkins Commission from 1977 to 1981.

title: Guido Brunner
text: He was a Member of the Bundestag from 1980 to 1981, Senator for the Economy in the government of West Berlin in 1981 and Ambassador to Spain from 1981 to 1992.

title: Guido Brunner
text: Tam Dalyell described him as "one of the unsung architects of the Europe we have today."

title: Jenkins Commission (EU)
text: The Jenkins Commission was the European Commission that held office from 6 January 1977 to 6 January 1981.

title: Jenkins Commission (EU)
text: Its President was Roy Jenkins.

title: National Conservation Commission
text: The National Conservation Commission was appointed on June 8, 1908 by President Theodore Roosevelt and consisted of representatives of the United States Congress and relevant executive agency technocrats; Gifford Pinchot served as chairman of its executive committee.

title: National Conservation Commission
text: The commission was the fourth of seven conservation commissions and conferences established during Roosevelt's presidency (1901-1909).

title: National Conservation Commission
text: This commission had resulted from the first Conference of Governors just weeks earlier, which similarly had stemmed from the previous recommendations of the Inland Waterways Commission, presented to Congress in February 1908.

title: National Conservation Commission
text: The National Conservation Commission was divided into four sections, water, forests, lands, and minerals, with each having its own chairman; it prepared the first inventory of the nation's natural resources, in a three-volume report submitted to Congress at the beginning of 1909.

title: National Conservation Commission
text: The commissions findings also present Pinchot's concepts of resource management as a comprehensive policy recommendation for the government.

title: National Conservation Commission
text: Roosevelt and Pinchot wanted the Commission to continue, but Congress refused further funding.

title: Kothari Commission
text: Indian Education Commission (1964-1966), popularly known as Kothari Commission, was an ad hoc commission set up by the Government of India to examine all aspects of the educational sector in India, to evolve a general pattern of education and to advise guidelines and policies for the development of education in India.

title: Kothari Commission
text: It was formed on 14 July 1964 under the chairmanship of Daulat Singh Kothari, then chairman of the University Grants Commission.

title: Kothari Commission
text: The terms of reference of the commission was to formulate the general principles and guidelines for the development of education from primary level to the highest and advise the government on a standardized national pattern of education in India.

title: Kothari Commission
text: However, the medical and legal studies were excluded from the purview of the commission.

title: Kothari Commission
text: The tenancy of the commission was from 1964 to 1966 and the report was submitted by the commission on 29 June 1966.

title: Roy Jenkins
text: Roy Harris Jenkins, Baron Jenkins of Hillhead, (11 November 1920 – 5 January 2003) was a British Labour Party, SDP and Liberal Democrat politician, and biographer of British political leaders.

title: Financial Crisis Inquiry Commission
text: The Financial Crisis Inquiry Commission (FCIC) is a ten-member commission appointed by the United States government with the goal of investigating the causes of the financial crisis of 2007–2010.

title: Financial Crisis Inquiry Commission
text: The Commission has been nicknamed the Angelides Commission after the chairman, Phil Angelides.

title: Financial Crisis Inquiry Commission
text: The Commission has been compared to the Pecora Commission, which investigated the causes of the Great Depression in the 1930s, and has been nicknamed the New Pecora Commission.

title: Financial Crisis Inquiry Commission
text: Analogies have also been made to the 9/11 Commission, which examined the September 11 terrorist attacks.

title: Financial Crisis Inquiry Commission
text: The Commission does have the ability to subpoena documents and witnesses for testimony, a power that the Pecora Commission had but the 9/11 Commission did not.

title: Financial Crisis Inquiry Commission
text: The first public hearing of the Commission was held on January 13, 2010, with the presentation of testimony from various banking officials.

title: Financial Crisis Inquiry Commission
text: Hearings continued during 2010 with "hundreds" of other persons in business, academia, and government testifying.

title: Jenkins Commission (UK)
text: The Independent Commission on the Voting System, popularly known as the Jenkins Commission after its chairman Roy Jenkins, was a commission into possible reform of the United Kingdom electoral system.

title: Cornel West
text: Cornel Ronald West (born June 2, 1953) is an American philosopher, political activist, social critic, author, public intellectual, and prominent member of the Democratic Socialists of America.

title: Cornel West
text: West is an outspoken voice in American leftist politics, and as such has been critical of many center-left figures, including President Barack Obama and former Secretary of State and 2016 Democratic Presidential nominee Hillary Clinton.

title: Cornel West
text: He has held professorships at Harvard University, Princeton University, Yale University, Union Theological Seminary, and the University of Paris during his career.

title: Cornel West
text: He is also a frequent commentator on politics and social issues in many media outlets.

title: David Connolly (translator)
text: David John Connolly (born 1954) is an English-born Greek literary translator.

title: David Connolly (translator)
text: He has translated poetry and novels from Greek to English, including writing by Nikiforos Vrettakos, Odysseas Elytis, Kiki Dimoula and Nikos Engonopoulos.

title: David Carrasco
text: Davíd Lee Carrasco (born November 21, 1944) is a Mexican-American academic historian of religion, anthropologist, and Mesoamericanist scholar.

title: David Carrasco
text: As of 2001 he holds the inaugural appointment as Neil L. Rudenstine Professor of Latin America Studies at the Harvard Divinity School, in a joint appointment with the Faculty of Arts and Sciences' Department of Anthropology at Harvard University.

title: David Carrasco
text: Carrasco previously taught at the University of Colorado, Boulder and Princeton University and is known for his research and extensive publications on Mesoamerican religion and history, his public speaking as well as wider contributions within Latin American studies and Latino/a studies.

title: David Carrasco
text: He has made powerful critical statements about Latino contributions to US democracy in public dialogues with Cornel West, Toni Morrison, and Samuel P. Huntington.

title: David Carrasco
text: His work is known primarily for his illuminating writings on the ways human societies orient themselves with sacred places.

title: Race Matters
text: Race Matters is a social sciences book by Cornel West.

title: Race Matters
text: The book was first published on April 1, 1993 by Beacon Press.

title: Race Matters
text: The book analyzes moral authority and racial debates concerning skin color in the United States.

title: Race Matters
text: The book questions matters of economics and politics, as well as ethical issues and spirituality, and also addresses the crisis in black leadership.

title: Race Matters
text: West's collection of moral essays on race relations in America was on the "New York Times" best-seller lists for many weeks.

title: Race Matters
text: The profound book continues to be as important today as it was 25 years ago.

title: Race Matters
text: Beacon Press will publish a 25th Anniversary edition on December 5, 2017.

title: Tragoudia Gia Tous Mines
text: Tragoudia Gia Tous Mines (Songs For The Months; Greek: Τραγούδια Για Τους Μήνες ) is an album by popular Greek artist Eleftheria Arvanitaki and it was released in 1996.

title: Tragoudia Gia Tous Mines
text: It was written and arranged by Dimitris Papadimitriou and the lyrics are poems by Sappho, Maria Polydouri, Kostas Karyotakis, Odysseas Elytis and Michalis Ganas, as well as traditional couplets.

title: Tragoudia Gia Tous Mines
text: It sold over 60,000 copies in Greece and was certified Platinum.

title: Tragoudia Gia Tous Mines
text: The vinyl collector's edition release of the album was in the form of a small record player.

title: Tragoudia Gia Tous Mines
text: The CD album's package and the disk itself featured extensive artwork following mostly a theme on the sky and the constellations.

title: Odysseas Elytis
text: Odysseas Elytis (Greek: Οδυσσέας Ελύτης , ] , pen name of Odysseas Alepoudellis, Greek: Οδυσσέας Αλεπουδέλλης ; 2 November 1911 – 18 March 1996) was regarded as a major exponent of romantic modernism in Greece and the world.

title: Odysseas Elytis
text: In 1979 he was awarded the Nobel Prize in Literature.

title: Tavis Smiley
text: Tavis Smiley ( ; born September 13, 1964) is an American talk show host and author.

title: Tavis Smiley
text: Smiley was born in Gulfport, Mississippi, and grew up in Bunker Hill, Indiana.

title: Tavis Smiley
text: After attending Indiana University, he worked during the late 1980s as an aide to Tom Bradley, the mayor of Los Angeles.

title: Tavis Smiley
text: Smiley became a radio commentator in 1991 and, starting in 1996, he hosted the talk show "BET Talk" (later renamed "BET Tonight") on Black Entertainment Television (BET).

title: Tavis Smiley
text: After Smiley sold an exclusive interview of Sara Jane Olson to ABC News in 2001, BET declined to renew his contract that year.

title: Tavis Smiley
text: Smiley then began hosting "The Tavis Smiley Show" on National Public Radio (NPR) (2002–04) and currently hosts "Tavis Smiley" on the Public Broadcasting Service (PBS) on weekdays and "The Tavis Smiley Show" on Public Radio International (PRI).

title: Tavis Smiley
text: From 2010 to 2013, Smiley and Cornel West joined forces to host their own radio talk show, "Smiley & West".

title: Tavis Smiley
text: They were featured together interviewing musician Bill Withers in the 2009 documentary film "Still Bill".

title: Tavis Smiley
text: He is the new host of "Tavis Talks" on BlogTalkRadio's Tavis Smiley Network.

title: Kyriakos Charalambides
text: Kyriakos Charalambides (Greek: Κυριάκος Χαραλαμπίδης , Kyriacos Charalambides) is one of the most renowned and celebrated living Cypriot poets.

title: Kyriakos Charalambides
text: His poetry, essays, translations, and critical analysis celebrate the ideas of Western civilisation, expressed through the language and history of Greek culture.

title: Kyriakos Charalambides
text: His poetic opus adds to the tradition established by such modern Greek poets as Constantine P. Cavafy, Giorgos Seferis and Odysseas Elytis.

title: Kyriakos Charalambides
text: His poetry though holds steadfastly to the Greek Cypriot linguistic register.

title: Mytilene International Airport
text: Mytilene International Airport "Odysseas Elytis" (IATA: MJT, ICAO: LGMT) is the international airport of Mytilene, the capital of the Greek island Lesbos.

title: Mourning in America and Dreaming in Color
text: Mourning in America and Dreaming in Color is the fifth studio album by American rapper Brother Ali.

title: Mourning in America and Dreaming in Color
text: It was released via Rhymesayers Entertainment on September 18, 2012.

title: Mourning in America and Dreaming in Color
text: Entirely produced by Jake One, it includes a guest appearance from Dr. Cornel West.

title: Mourning in America and Dreaming in Color
text: It reached number 44 on the "Billboard" 200 chart.

title: Mourning in America and Dreaming in Color
text: It sold 10,000 copies in its first week of release.

title: Let There Be Love (1953 Joni James album)
text: Let There Be Love is Joni James debut album, recorded in 1953 and released by MGM Records at the end of the year.

title: Let There Be Love (1953 Joni James album)
text: It was released in a four-disc 10-inch 78-rpm record box, in both a two-disc 7-inch 45-rpm extended-play foldout album and a four-disc 45-rpm regular-play box and on a 10-inch 331⁄3-rpm album.

title: Let There Be Love (1953 Joni James album)
text: The serial number, 222, coincidentally included James's lucky number, "22," which appeared in many of her record serial numbers all over the world.

title: Let There Be Love (1953 Joni James album)
text: The album is the first to present its songs as a book in music, opening with "Let There Be Love" and closing with "I'll Be Seeing You", with the songs telling a story start to finish.

title: Let There Be Love (1953 Joni James album)
text: The memorable cover was done at M-G-M Pictures Studios in Culver City by artist Russ Gale.

title: Let There Be Love (1953 Joni James album)
text: From the album a single of "Let There Be Love" and "You're Nearer" was shipped to radio stations.

title: Let There Be Love (1953 Joni James album)
text: Then, by public demand, a single of "You're My Everything" and "You're Nearer" was released.

title: Let There Be Love (1953 Joni James album)
text: This album offered Joni's second recording of "Let There Be Love," which had been released in an earlier version in 1952 as her first single on Sharp Records in Chicago, then going to M-G-M Records for further distribution.

title: Let There Be Love (1953 Joni James album)
text: Both recordings were arranged and conducted by Lew Douglas.

title: Let There Be Love (1953 Joni James album)
text: "Let There Be Love" went to the top of the album charts and was the sixth-best-selling album of 1953.

title: Let There Be Love (1953 Joni James album)
text: In 1956 the album was reissued as a 12-inch L.P. and in three single EPs; there was no EP set including the entire album.

title: Let There Be Love (1953 Joni James album)
text: For this release, four Joni James singles were added, but one of them had never been released.

title: Let There Be Love (1953 Joni James album)
text: That was "I Need You Now," which was to have followed the hit "My Love, My Love" but was canceled when Eddie Fisher came out with a version recorded several weeks after Joni's.

title: Let There Be Love (1953 Joni James album)
text: M-G-M had expected Joni's original version to go straight to #1.

title: Let There Be Love (1953 Joni James album)
text: For the new album the first four songs and second four songs were switched to get "You're My Everything" in the outside groove of the L.P. to facilitate disc jockey play.

title: Let There Be Love (1953 Joni James album)
text: So, for 50 years, the story the album tells has been garbled.

title: Let There Be Love (1953 Joni James album)
text: In 1961 the album got new cover art, a new serial number (E3931), and an electronically simulated stereo release.

title: Let There Be Love (1953 Joni James album)
text: Released again on compact disk with yet more bonus tracks, the album is in its fifth decade as a best seller.

title: Let There Be Love (1953 Joni James album)
text: Joni James hopes for yet another release which will restore the original song order.

title: Let There Be Love (1953 Joni James album)
text: Significantly, for her last M-G-M album, "Bossa Nova Style", Joni included new recordings of several songs from "Let There Be Love", including a new single of "You're Nearer."

title: Let There Be Love (1953 Joni James album)
text: That album was arranged by Lew Douglas's protégé Chuck Sagle.

title: Let There Be Love (1953 Joni James album)
text: This information comes from Wayne Brasler, longtime President of the Joni James International Fan Club and the writer of the album notes for all Joni James' CD releases.

title: Say It Right
text: "Say It Right" is a song by Canadian singer Nelly Furtado from her third studio album "Loose" (2006).

title: Say It Right
text: Written by Furtado, Tim "Timbaland" Mosley and Nate "Danja" Hills, the song was inspired by, as Furtado described it, the "spooky, keyboard-driven pop sound" of the band Eurythmics, specifically their 1983 song "Here Comes the Rain Again".

title: Say It Right
text: The song released as the album's third single in North America and Australia (see 2006 in music).

title: Say It Right
text: The song served as the album's fourth single in certain European and Asian countries.

title: Say It Right
text: It was released digitally in the United Kingdom in March 2007.

title: Say It Right
text: It was the album's fifth single in Latin America.

title: Ascension (Gorillaz song)
text: "Ascension" is a song by alternative rock virtual band Gorillaz, featuring Vince Staples.

title: Ascension (Gorillaz song)
text: The song was released on 23 March 2017.

title: Ascension (Gorillaz song)
text: It was released as the third single from their fifth studio album "Humanz".

title: Let Me Out (Gorillaz song)
text: "Let Me Out" is a song by alternative rock virtual band Gorillaz, featuring Pusha T and Mavis Staples.

title: Let Me Out (Gorillaz song)
text: The song was released on 6 April 2017.

title: Let Me Out (Gorillaz song)
text: It was released as the fifth single from their fifth studio album "Humanz".

title: Tears Always Win
text: "Tears Always Win" is a song recorded by American singer-songwriter Alicia Keys for her fifth studio album, "Girl on Fire" (2012).

title: Tears Always Win
text: It was written by Keys, along with Bruno Mars, Jeff Bhasker and Phillip Lawrence, and produced by Keys and Bhasker.

title: Tears Always Win
text: It was digitally released on May 7, 2013, as the fifth single from "Girl on Fire".

title: Tears Always Win
text: Keys debuted the single during a performance on "American Idol" on May 9, 2013.

title: Tears Always Win
text: The song has been met with general critical acclaim from critics.

title: Tears Always Win
text: Keys included the song in the setlist for her fifth concert tour, the Set the World on Fire Tour.

title: Tears Always Win
text: It is being released as the second Top 40/Mainstream single following the lead single "Girl on Fire".

title: Tears Always Win
text: Keys also performed the song on the May 9, 2013 episode of "American Idol".

title: Chi-Town (song)
text: "Chi-Town" is the first single taken from the fifth studio album by British indie rock band The Cribs, released in February 2012.

title: Chi-Town (song)
text: The song was the band's first new material since "Housewife" in August 2010, and later found release on fifth LP "In the Belly of the Brazen Bull" in May 2012.

title: Chi-Town (song)
text: BBC Radio 1 DJ Zane Lowe premiered the track, playing it three times on his show one evening, and "Chi-Town" was immediately released as a free digital download on a variety of music news websites.

title: Chi-Town (song)
text: Recorded and mixed at Electrical Audio studio, Chicago with engineer Steve Albini, the song received mastering treatment in Sterling Sound, New York City from Greg Calbi.

title: Humanz
text: Humanz is the fifth studio album by British virtual band Gorillaz.

title: Humanz
text: The album was released on 28 April 2017 via Parlophone and Warner Bros.

title: Humanz
text: Records.

title: Humanz
text: The album was announced on the band's official Instagram page on 23 March 2017.

title: Humanz
text: According to a press release, the album was recorded in London, Paris, New York City, Chicago, and Jamaica and produced by Gorillaz, The Twilite Tone and Remi Kabaka, Jr.

title: Humanz
text: It is the band's first studio album since 2010's "The Fall", and features collaborations from several artists including Grace Jones, Kali Uchis, Vince Staples, Popcaan, D.R.A.M., Anthony Hamilton, De La Soul, Danny Brown, Kelela, Mavis Staples, Pusha T, and Benjamin Clementine.

title: We Got the Power (Gorillaz song)
text: "We Got the Power" is a song by alternative rock virtual band Gorillaz, featuring Jehnny Beth of British post-punk band Savages and backing vocals from former Oasis guitarist and songwriter Noel Gallagher and American rapper D.R.A.M., who also appears on the group's single "Andromeda".

title: We Got the Power (Gorillaz song)
text: The song was released on 23 March 2017.

title: We Got the Power (Gorillaz song)
text: It was released as the second single from their fifth studio album "Humanz".

title: Saturnz Barz
text: "Saturnz Barz" is a song by British virtual band Gorillaz, featuring Jamaican dancehall artist Popcaan.

title: Saturnz Barz
text: The song was released on 23 March 2017.

title: Saturnz Barz
text: It was released as the first single from their fifth studio album "Humanz".

title: Saturnz Barz
text: The song marks the group's comeback since 2012's "DoYaThing", although 2017 had seen the non-single release of the song "Hallelujah Money" which features English singer Benjamin Clementine.

title: Saturnz Barz
text: "Saturnz Barz" was produced by frontman Damon Albarn, Remi Kabaka and producer The Twilite Tone, and marks the group's first collaboration with Popcaan.

title: Saturnz Barz
text: A remix was released later by Banx & Ranx.

title: Everglow
text: "Everglow" is a song by British rock band Coldplay.

title: Everglow
text: It is the fourth track, promotional single and fifth single proper from their seventh studio album, "A Head Full of Dreams".

title: Everglow
text: The song features uncredited guest vocals by Gwyneth Paltrow, the ex-wife of Chris Martin.

title: Everglow
text: The song was served as a promotional single of the album and released on 26 November 2015.

title: Everglow
text: The track was also premiered during Zane Lowe's Beats 1 radio show.

title: Everglow
text: On 11 November 2016 it was released digitally as the fifth single proper from the album, in a newly-recorded stripped-down version that was inspired by Martin's unrehearsed solo performance of the song at the recent Glastonbury Festival due to a technical mishap.

title: Everglow
text: The version ended with a sample of Muhammad Ali's 1977 speech in Newcastle upon Tyne.

title: Greenwich Mean Time
text: Greenwich Mean Time (GMT) is the mean solar time at the Royal Observatory in Greenwich, London.

title: Greenwich Mean Time
text: GMT was formerly used as the international civil time standard, now superseded in that function by Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).

title: Greenwich Mean Time
text: Today GMT is considered equivalent to UTC for UK civil purposes (but this is not formalised) and for navigation is considered equivalent to UT1 (the modern form of mean solar time at 0° longitude); these two meanings can differ by up to 0.9 s. Consequently, the term GMT should not be used for precise purposes.

title: Fractional lambda switching
text: Fractional lambda switching (FλS) leverages on time-driven switching (TDS) to realize sub-lambda switching in highly scalable dynamic optical networking, which requires minimum (possibly optical) buffers.

title: Fractional lambda switching
text: Fractional lambda switching implies switching fractions of optical channels as opposed to whole lambda switching where whole optical channels are the switching unit.

title: Fractional lambda switching
text: In this context, TDS has the same general objectives as optical burst switching and optical packet switching: realizing all-optical networks with high wavelength utilization.

title: Fractional lambda switching
text: TDS operation is based on time frames (TFs) that can be viewed as virtual containers for multiple IP packets that are switched at every TDS switch based on and coordinated by the UTC (coordinated universal time) signal implementing pipeline forwarding.

title: Fractional lambda switching
text: In the context of optical networks, synchronous virtual pipes SVPs typical of pipeline forwarding are called fractional lambda pipes (FλPs).

title: Civil time
text: In modern usage, civil time refers to statutory time scales designated by civilian authorities, or to local time indicated by clocks.

title: Civil time
text: Modern civil time is generally standard time in a time zone at a fixed offset from Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) or from Greenwich Mean Time (GMT), possibly adjusted by daylight saving time during part of the year.

title: Civil time
text: UTC is calculated by reference to atomic clocks, and was adopted in 1972.

title: Civil time
text: Older systems use telescope observations.

title: Mountain Time Zone
text: The Mountain Time Zone of North America keeps time by subtracting seven hours from Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) when standard time is in effect, and by subtracting six hours during daylight saving time (UTC−6).

title: Mountain Time Zone
text: The clock time in this zone is based on the mean solar time at the 105th meridian west of the Greenwich Observatory.

title: Mountain Time Zone
text: In the United States, the exact specification for the location of time zones and the dividing lines between zones is set forth in the Code of Federal Regulations at 49 CFR 71.

title: Time in Malaysia
text: Malaysia Standard Time (MST; Malay: "Waktu Piawai Malaysia" , WPM ) or Malaysia Time (MYT) is a standard time used in Malaysia.

title: Time in Malaysia
text: It is 8 hours ahead of Greenwich Mean Time and Coordinated Universal Time.

title: Time in Malaysia
text: The local mean time in Kuala Lumpur was originally .

title: Time in Malaysia
text: Peninsular Malaysia used this local mean time until 1880, when they changed to Singapore mean time .

title: Time in Malaysia
text: Between the end of the Second World War and the formation of Malaysia on 16 September 1963, it was known as British Malayan Standard Time, which was hours ahead of Greenwich Mean Time.

title: Time in Malaysia
text: At 2330 hrs local time of 31 December 1981, people in Peninsular Malaysia adjusted their clocks and watches ahead by 30 minutes to become 00:00 hours local time of 1 January 1982, to match the time in use in East Malaysia, which is .

title: Time in Malaysia
text: SGT (Singapore) as follow on the same until now.

title: Deal Timeball
text: Deal Timeball is a Victorian maritime Greenwich Mean Time signal located on the roof of a waterfront four-storey tower in the coastal town of Deal, in Kent, England.

title: Deal Timeball
text: It was established in 1855 by the Astronomer Royal George Biddell Airy in collaboration with Charles V. Walker, superintendent of telegraphs for the South Eastern Railway Company.

title: Deal Timeball
text: It was built by the Lambeth firm of engineers Maudslay and Field.

title: Deal Timeball
text: The time ball, which, like the Greenwich time ball, fell at 1 pm precisely, was triggered by an electric signal directly from the Royal Observatory.

title: DUT1
text: The time correction DUT1 (sometimes also written DUT) is the difference between Universal Time (UT1), which is defined by Earth's rotation, and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC), which is defined by a network of precision atomic clocks.

title: Day
text: A day is a unit of time.

title: Day
text: In common usage, it is either an interval equal to 24 hours or daytime, the consecutive period of time during which the Sun is above the horizon.

title: Day
text: The period of time during which the Earth completes one rotation with respect to the Sun is called a "solar day".

title: Day
text: Several definitions of this universal human concept are used according to context, need and convenience.

title: Day
text: In 1960, the second was redefined in terms of the orbital motion of the Earth, and was designated the SI base unit of time.

title: Day
text: The unit of measurement "day", redefined in 1960 as 86 400 SI seconds and symbolized "d", is not an SI unit, but is accepted for use with SI.

title: Day
text: A civil day is usually 86 400 seconds, plus or minus a possible leap second in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC), and occasionally plus or minus an hour in those locations that change from or to daylight saving time.

title: Day
text: The word "day" may also refer to a day of the week or to a calendar date, as in answer to the question, "On which day?"

title: Day
text: The life patterns of humans and many other species are related to Earth's solar day and the day-night cycle (see circadian rhythms).

title: Universal Time
text: Universal Time (UT) is a time standard based on Earth's rotation.

title: Universal Time
text: It is a modern continuation of Greenwich Mean Time (GMT), i.e., the mean solar time on the Prime Meridian at Greenwich, London, UK.

title: Universal Time
text: In fact, the expression "Universal Time" is ambiguous (when accuracy of better than a few seconds is required), as there are several versions of it, the most commonly used being Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) and UT1 (see below).

title: Universal Time
text: All of these versions of UT, except for UTC, are based on Earth's rotation relative to distant celestial objects (stars and quasars), but with a scaling factor and other adjustments to make them closer to solar time.

title: Universal Time
text: UTC is based on International Atomic Time, with leap seconds added to keep it within 0.9 second of UT1.

title: Central European Time
text: Central European Time (CET), used in most parts of Europe and a few North African countries, is a standard time which is 1 hour ahead of Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).

title: Central European Time
text: The time offset from UTC can be written as .

title: Central European Time
text: The same standard time, , is also known as Middle European Time (MET, German: ) and under other names like Berlin Time, Romance Standard Time (RST), Paris Time or Rome Time.

title: Emo
text: Emo is a genre of rock music characterized by an emphasis on emotional expression, sometimes through confessional lyrics.

title: Emo
text: It emerged as a style of post-hardcore from the mid-1980s hardcore punk movement of Washington, D.C., where it was known as emotional hardcore or emocore and pioneered by Washington, D.C. hardcore bands such as Rites of Spring and Embrace.

title: Emo
text: However, as the genre was taken up by a new generation of musicians in the early 1990s, its sound and meaning shifted and changed and it was reinvented as a style of indie rock and pop punk by bands such as Jawbreaker, Sunny Day Real Estate, Weezer, and Jimmy Eat World.

title: Emo
text: By the mid-1990s, numerous emo acts such as Braid, The Promise Ring, and the Get Up Kids emerged in the Midwestern and Central United States, and several independent record labels began to specialize in the genre.

title: Emo
text: Meanwhile, a more aggressive style of emo, screamo, had also emerged, pioneered by the San Diego bands Heroin and Antioch Arrow.

title: Die anderen Bands
text: Die anderen Bands (] , "the other bands") is a term combining alternative music bands of 1980s GDR (East Germany).

title: Die anderen Bands
text: They shared a more or less open criticism of their country's political system, and a high degree of creativity which was lacking from the more established music scene of East Germany.

title: Die anderen Bands
text: Many members of these bands played significant parts during the time of political change "Wende" in 1989.

title: Die anderen Bands
text: The bands came from a broad range of musical genres, especially Punk, Blues, Wave, Indie and Electronic music.

title: Lines Across Maps
text: Lines Across Maps are a British math rock band based in Lincolnshire, England.

title: Lines Across Maps
text: Their music is characterized by a use of complex time signatures and heavy, guitar driven sounds.

title: Lines Across Maps
text: In December 2011, shortly after the release of their debut EP, Stuart Smith of This Town Needs Guns described the band as "a lot like Colour (now defunct UK math rock band)".

title: Lines Across Maps
text: The name Lines Across Maps is taken from the This Town Needs Guns song "It's Not True Rufus, Don't Listen To The Hat".

title: Lines Across Maps
text: Lines Across Maps cite bands such as Jocasta Sleeps, Reuben, Oceansize, Biffy Clyro, Twin Atlantic, Blakfish and Meet Me In St Louis as major influences.

title: Riverbeds (band)
text: Riverbeds is a Canadian post-rock/emo band from Montreal, Qc formed in 2010.

title: Riverbeds (band)
text: The band made its recording debut in 2012 with the EP "Hiding Small Things In Obvious Places" which was released on November 24 at Panda Bar.

title: Riverbeds (band)
text: Riverbeds musical style has been described by Indecent Xposure as being influenced by "Thrice, The Almost and Circa Survive amongst others".

title: Riverbeds (band)
text: The band shared the stage with both local and international bands, including Daylight (now Superheaven), Tyler Daniel Bean and Stuck On Planet Earth.

title: The Works Recording Studio
text: The Works Recording Studio was a recording studio located in Stockport, Greater Manchester, UK between 1998 and 2007.

title: The Works Recording Studio
text: Built in a Victorian rectory it was originally an analogue studio used by unsigned bands and fading stars of Manchester's rich musical scene including ex-members of The Smiths and The Stone Roses.

title: The Works Recording Studio
text: In 2001 it installed a Pro Tools system, and then recorded albums for bands such as Amplifier, Oceansize, Inertia Blooms and Performance.

title: The Works Recording Studio
text: In 2005 there was a bizarre 3 a.m. appearance by U.S. rap star Snoop Dogg who visited the studio after playing a concert, bringing an entourage of musicians, enormous bodyguards and a chef.

title: The Works Recording Studio
text: The studio also branched out into making music videos.

title: The Works Recording Studio
text: In 2007 "Super Producer" Timbaland used the studio whilst on tour with Justin Timberlake.

title: Morbid Angel
text: Morbid Angel is an American death metal band based in Tampa, Florida formed in 1983 by guitarist and sole remaining original member Trey Azagthoth, original vocalist and bassist Dallas Ward, and original drummer Mike Browning.

title: Morbid Angel
text: Widely considered as one of the most influential bands in the genre and important in the transition of death metal from its thrash metal roots, they were one of the first bands to incorporate guttural vocals, up-tempo blast beats, atonality in guitar playing, multiple tempo changes and dark atmosphere.

title: Morbid Angel
text: They have been described as one of "the most influential and emulated bands in death metal", alongside Cannibal Corpse, and have been cited as an influence by many later bands.

title: Morbid Angel
text: They were also the first death metal band to experience mainstream success in connection with being signed to Giant Records in 1992, heavy rotation of their music videos on MTV, and having the music video for the song "God of Emptiness" shown on an episode of "Beavis and Butt-head".

title: Morbid Angel
text: Their first four albums are considered classics in the genre.

title: Superheaven
text: Superheaven (formerly known as Daylight) is an American alternative rock band from Doylestown, Pennsylvania, formed in 2008.

title: Superheaven
text: Their music has been described as reminiscent of 1990s grunge and shoegazing, but Taylor Madison has expressed a dislike for such labels, describing it simply as rock/rock and roll.

title: Oceansize
text: Oceansize were an English rock band from Manchester, formed in 1998.

title: Oceansize
text: The band consisted of Mike Vennart (vocals, guitar), Steve Durose (guitar, backing vocals), Richard "Gambler" Ingram (guitar, keyboards), Mark Heron (drums) and Jon Ellis (bass guitar) for the majority of its career, with Steve Hodson replacing Ellis on bass guitar in 2006.

title: Celtic metal
text: Celtic metal is a subgenre of folk metal that developed in the 1990s in Ireland.

title: Celtic metal
text: As the name suggests, the genre is a fusion of heavy metal and Celtic rock.

title: Celtic metal
text: The early pioneers of the genre were the Irish bands Cruachan, Primordial and Waylander.

title: Celtic metal
text: The genre has since expanded beyond Irish shores and is known to be performed today by bands from numerous other countries.

title: Stoner rock
text: Stoner rock or stoner metal is a rock music fusion genre that combines elements of heavy metal and/or doom metal with psychedelic rock and acid rock.

title: Stoner rock
text: The name references cannabis consumption.

title: Stoner rock
text: The term desert rock is often used interchangeably with the term "stoner rock" to describe this genre; however, not all stoner rock bands would fall under the descriptor of "desert rock".

title: Stoner rock
text: Stoner rock is typically slow-to-mid tempo and features a heavily distorted, groove laden bass-heavy sound, melodic vocals, and "retro" production.

title: Stoner rock
text: The genre emerged during the early 1990s and was pioneered foremost by the Californian bands Kyuss and Sleep.

title: Nell Gwynn (1934 film)
text: Nell Gwynn is a 1934 British historical drama film directed by Herbert Wilcox and starring Anna Neagle, Cedric Hardwicke, Jeanne de Casalis, Miles Malleson and Moore Marriott.

title: Nell Gwynn (1934 film)
text: The film portrays the historical romance between Charles II of England and the actress Nell Gwynn.

title: Nell Gwynn (1934 film)
text: In the opening credits, the screenplay is attributed to Miles Malleson, "in collaboration with King Charles II, Samuel Pepys and Nell Gwyn."

title: Nell Gwynn (1934 film)
text: It was also released as Mistress Nell Gwyn.

title: Immortal Gentleman
text: Immortal Gentleman is a 1935 British historical drama film directed by Widgey R. Newman and starring Basil Gill, Rosalinde Fuller and Dennis Hoey.

title: Immortal Gentleman
text: It was a low-budget B film, which usually did not have historical settings.

title: Dick Turpin (1933 film)
text: Dick Turpin is a 1933 British historical drama film directed by Victor Hanbury and John Stafford it starred Victor McLaglen, Jane Carr, Frank Vosper, James Finlayson and Cecil Humphreys.

title: Dick Turpin (1933 film)
text: The film depicts the adventures of the eighteenth century highwayman Dick Turpin and his legendary ride to York.

title: Dick Turpin (1933 film)
text: It is based on a historical novel by Harrison Ainsworth.

title: The Weavers (1927 film)
text: The Weavers (German: Die Weber) is a 1927 German silent historical drama film directed by Frederic Zelnik and starring Paul Wegener, Valeska Stock and Hermann Picha.

title: The Weavers (1927 film)
text: The film is based on the 1892 play "of the same title" by Gerhart Hauptmann based on a historical event.

title: The Weavers (1927 film)
text: The film's art direction was by Andrej Andrejew.

title: Jauja (film)
text: Jauja is a 2014 internationally co-produced historical drama film co-written and directed by Lisandro Alonso.

title: Jauja (film)
text: It competed in the Un Certain Regard section at the 2014 Cannes Film Festival where it won the FIPRESCI Prize.

title: Lisandro Alonso
text: Lisandro Alonso (born 2 June 1975) is an Argentine film director and screenwriter.

title: Lisandro Alonso
text: He has directed six feature-length films and a short film since 2001 and is loosely associated with the "New Argentine Cinema" movement.

title: Lisandro Alonso
text: His film "La libertad" was screened in the Un Certain Regard section at the 2001 Cannes Film Festival.

title: Lisandro Alonso
text: His 2014 film "Jauja" competed in the Un Certain Regard section at the 2014 Cannes Film Festival, where it won the FIPRESCI Prize.

title: Lisandro Alonso
text: In addition, he was named Film Society of Lincoln Center 2014 Filmmaker in Residence on 24 June 2014.

title: Red Shirts (film)
text: Red Shirts (Italian:Camicie rosse) is a 1952 French-Italian historical drama film directed by Goffredo Alessandrini and Francesco Rosi and starring Anna Magnani, Raf Vallone and Alain Cuny.

title: Red Shirts (film)
text: The title refers to the historical Redshirts.

title: Red Shirts (film)
text: It is also known as Anita Garibaldi.

title: Red Shirts (film)
text: The film portrays the life of Anita Garibaldi (1821–1849), the wife of Italian unification leader Giuseppe Garibaldi.

title: La Commune (Paris, 1871)
text: La Commune (Paris, 1871) is a 2000 historical drama film directed by Peter Watkins about the Paris Commune.

title: La Commune (Paris, 1871)
text: A historical re-enactment in the style of a documentary, the film received much acclaim from critics for its political themes and Watkins' direction.

title: No (2012 film)
text: No is a 2012 internationally co-produced historical drama film directed by Pablo Larraín.

title: No (2012 film)
text: The film is based on the unpublished play "El Plebiscito", written by Antonio Skármeta.

title: No (2012 film)
text: Mexican actor Gael García Bernal plays René, an in-demand advertising man working in Chile in the late 1980s.

title: No (2012 film)
text: The film captures the historical moment of advertising tactics in political campaigns as in the 1988 plebiscite, when the Chilean citizenry decided whether or not dictator Augusto Pinochet should stay in power for another eight years.

title: The Assassin of Rome
text: The Assassin of Rome (Italian: "Girolimoni, il mostro di Roma" ) is a 1972 Italian historical drama film directed by Damiano Damiani.

title: The Assassin of Rome
text: The film tells, with some historical licenses, the story of Gino Girolimoni, wrongfully accused of a series of child murders that occurred in Rome between 1924 and 1928.

title: Heroes in the Wind
text: Heroes in the Wind: From Kull to Conan; the Best of Robert E. Howard is a 2009 collection of dark fantasy and horror short stories written by Robert E. Howard, selected and with an introduction by John Clute.

title: Heroes in the Wind
text: Most of the stories were originally published in various fantasy magazines and feature Howard's heroes Kull, Bran Mak Morn and Conan, among others.

title: Heroes in the Wind
text: It was first published in paperback in September 2009 by Penguin Books in its Penguin Modern Classics series.

title: Conan: Adventures in an Age Undreamed Of
text: Robert E. Howard's Conan: Adventures in an Age Undreamed Of, or simply Conan: Adventures in an Age Undreamed Of, is a sword and sorcery British pen-and-paper role-playing game set in the world of Conan the Barbarian, the fictional Hyborian Age.

title: Conan: Adventures in an Age Undreamed Of
text: Both the character and the setting were first imagined by American author Robert E. Howard (1906-1936) as of 1932 and until his suicide in 1936.

title: Conan: Adventures in an Age Undreamed Of
text: Howard's original literary work has since spawned a vast franchise of novels, comic books, films, video games, board games, role-playing games, etc.

title: Conan: Adventures in an Age Undreamed Of
text: Following this tradition, "Conan: Adventures in an Age Undreamed Of" is the third officially licensed Conan role-playing game.

title: Conan: Adventures in an Age Undreamed Of
text: The two precedent games were "Conan Role-Playing Game" (1985-1988) and "" (2004-2010), although there also had been supplements for independent generic systems, like "GURPS Conan" (1988-1989).

title: Valeria (Conan the Barbarian)
text: Valeria is a pirate and adventuress (a member of "The Red Brotherhood" of pirates) in the fictional universe of Robert E. Howard's Conan the Barbarian stories.

title: Valeria (Conan the Barbarian)
text: She appears in Robert E. Howard's Conan novella "Red Nails", serialized in "Weird Tales" 28 1-3 (July, August/September & October 1936).

title: Valeria (Conan the Barbarian)
text: This was the last Conan story written by Howard, and published posthumously.

title: Valeria (Conan the Barbarian)
text: The name was also used for Conan's love interest in the 1982 film "Conan the Barbarian".

title: Optometry
text: Optometry is a health care profession which involves examining the eyes and applicable visual systems for defects or abnormalities as well as the medical diagnosis and management of eye disease.

title: Optometry
text: Traditionally, the field of optometry began with the primary focus of correcting refractive error through the use of spectacles.

title: Optometry
text: Modern day optometry, however, has evolved through time so that the education curriculum additionally includes intensive medical training in the diagnosis and management of ocular disease in countries where the profession is established and regulated.

title: Optometry
text: Optometrists (also known as Doctors of Optometry in the US and Canada for those holding the O.D. degree or Ophthalmic Opticians in the UK) are medical professionals who provide primary eyecare through comprehensive eye examinations to detect and treat various visual abnormalities and eye diseases.

title: Optometry
text: Being a regulated profession, an optometrist's scope of practice may differ depending on the location.

title: Optometry
text: Thus, disorders or diseases detected outside the treatment scope of optometry are referred out to relevant medical professionals for proper care, more commonly to ophthalmologists who are physicians that specialize in tertiary medical and surgical care of the eye.

title: Optometry
text: Optometrists typically work closely together with other eye care professionals such as ophthalmologists and opticians to deliver quality and efficient eyecare to the general public.

title: Lee Family Digital Archive
text: The Lee Family Digital Archive is a scholarly effort to collect, edit, and disseminate the papers of the Lee family of Virginia.

title: Lee Family Digital Archive
text: The Lees of Virginia included Richard Lee I, the immigrant founder of the family, who came to Virginia from England around 1640, and his descendants.

title: Lee Family Digital Archive
text: Some of the most famous Lees are Thomas Lee, the President of Virginia; Richard Henry Lee and Francis Lightfoot Lee, signers of the Declaration of Independence; Arthur Lee, the Penman of the Revolution; Light-Horse Harry Lee, the cavalry hero of the Continental army, three-time governor of Virginia, and the father of Robert E. Lee; Thomas Sim Lee, Revolutionary governor of Maryland; Richard Bland Lee, U.S. Senator; Charles Lee, U.S. Supreme Court justice; Richard Bland Lee II, a noted explorer; Robert E. Lee, the Confederate general who is by far the most famous of the family; William Henry Fitzhugh (Rooney) Lee, the son of Robert E. Lee and a U.S. Congressman from Virginia; and Fitzhugh Lee, Governor of Virginia and Civil War cavalry general.

title: Lee Family Digital Archive
text: President Zachary Taylor was a Lee descendant, on his mother's side.

title: Richard Ford
text: Richard Ford (born February 16, 1944) is an American novelist and short story writer.

title: Richard Ford
text: His best-known works are the novel "The Sportswriter" and its sequels, "Independence Day", "The Lay of the Land" and "Let Me Be Frank With You", and the short story collection "Rock Springs", which contains several widely anthologized stories.

title: Legacy of Robert E. Howard
text: Robert E. Howard's legacy extended after his death in 1936.

title: Legacy of Robert E. Howard
text: Howard's most famous character, Conan the Barbarian, has a pop-culture imprint that has been compared to such icons as Tarzan of the Apes, Count Dracula, Sherlock Holmes, and James Bond.

title: Legacy of Robert E. Howard
text: Howard's critical reputation suffered at first but over the decades works of Howard scholarship have been published.

title: Legacy of Robert E. Howard
text: The first professionally published example of this was L. Sprague de Camp's "Dark Valley Destiny" (1983) which was followed by other works, including Don Herron's "The Dark Barbarian" (1984) and Mark Finn's "" (2006).

title: Legacy of Robert E. Howard
text: Also in 2006, a charity, Robert E. Howard Foundation, was created to promote further scholarship.

title: Robert E. Howard
text: Robert Ervin Howard (January 22, 1906 – June 11, 1936) was an American author who wrote pulp fiction in a diverse range of genres.

title: Robert E. Howard
text: He is well known for his character Conan the Barbarian and is regarded as the father of the sword and sorcery subgenre.

title: Red Sonja (film)
text: Red Sonja is a 1985 Dutch-American sword and sorcery action film directed by Richard Fleischer.

title: Red Sonja (film)
text: The film introduces Brigitte Nielsen as the title character with Arnold Schwarzenegger, Sandahl Bergman, Ronald Lacey, Ernie Reyes, Jr., Paul L. Smith and Pat Roach in supporting roles.

title: Red Sonja (film)
text: The film features the sword-wielding Marvel Comics character Red Sonja, created by Roy Thomas, who first appeared in Marvel's "Conan the Barbarian" series (#23) in 1973.

title: Red Sonja (film)
text: The film's character of Red Sonja was based on Red Sonya of Rogatino, a character created by Robert E. Howard appearing in his short story "The Shadow of the Vulture" (1934).

title: Red Sonja (film)
text: The film acknowledges that it was "based on the character created by Robert E. Howard" in the introductory credits.

title: National Association for Chiropractic Medicine
text: The National Association for Chiropractic Medicine (NACM) was a minority chiropractic association founded in 1984 that described itself as a "consumer advocacy association of chiropractors".

title: National Association for Chiropractic Medicine
text: It openly rejected some of the more controversial aspects of chiropractic, including a basic concept of chiropractic, vertebral subluxations as the cause of all diseases.

title: National Association for Chiropractic Medicine
text: It also sought to "reform the chiropractic profession away from a philosophical scope of practice and towards an applied science scope of practice."

title: National Association for Chiropractic Medicine
text: It stated that it was "dedicated to bringing the scientific based practice of chiropractic into mainstream medicine" and that its members "confine their scope of practice to scientific parameters and seek to make legitimate the utilization of professional manipulative procedures in mainstream health care delivery."

title: National Association for Chiropractic Medicine
text: "While the NACM is focused on furthering the profession, its primary focus is on the rights and safety of the consumers."

title: National Association for Chiropractic Medicine
text: The NACM was the object of much controversy and criticism from the rest of the profession.

title: National Association for Chiropractic Medicine
text: It quietly dropped out of sight and its demise apparently occurred sometime between May 30, 2008 and March 6, 2010.

title: Bell UH-1 Iroquois
text: The Bell UH-1 Iroquois (nicknamed "Huey") is a utility military helicopter powered by a single turboshaft engine, with two-blade main and tail rotors.

title: Bell UH-1 Iroquois
text: The first member of the prolific Huey family, it was developed by Bell Helicopter to meet a United States Army's 1952 requirement for a medical evacuation and utility helicopter, and first flew in 1956.

title: Bell UH-1 Iroquois
text: The UH-1 was the first turbine-powered helicopter to enter production in 1960 for the United States military, and more than 16,000 have been built since.

title: Aérospatiale SA 321 Super Frelon
text: The Aérospatiale (formerly Sud Aviation) SA 321 Super Frelon ("Super Hornet") is a three-engined heavy transport helicopter produced by aerospace manufacturer Sud Aviation (later Aérospatiale) of France.

title: Aérospatiale SA 321 Super Frelon
text: It held the distinction of being the most powerful helicopter to be built in Europe at one point, as well as being the world's fastest helicopter.

title: Harbin Z-20
text: The Harbin Z-20 or Zhi-20 is a medium lift helicopter produced in the Northeast of China.

title: Harbin Z-20
text: Its first flight was on 23 December 2013.

title: Harbin Z-20
text: The helicopter has a maximum takeoff weight in the range of 10 tons, can drop troops at locations of up to 3,000 ft altitude, and could operate from the Chinese aircraft carrier Liaoning.

title: Harbin Z-20
text: It is thought to be comparable to the US made Sikorsky UH-60 Black Hawk helicopter, the civilian Sikorsky S-70C-2 variant of which has been used by the People's Liberation Army since 1984.

title: Harbin Z-20
text: Some sources suggest that the Z-20 is a copy of the Black Hawk and link the design to the Black Hawk that was abandoned by US special forces in Pakistan during the operation to kill Osama bin Laden on 1 May 2011.

title: Harbin Z-20
text: The sources say that Pakistan allowed Chinese officials to examine the Black Hawk wreckage.

title: Harbin Z-20
text: However, Aviation Week also points out that although some aspects of the design do appear similar, such as the tail wheel arrangement, there are also marked differences.

title: Harbin Z-20
text: For example, the Chinese Z-20 has a five blade rotor compared with the Black Hawks' four blades.

title: Kawasaki KH-4
text: The Kawasaki KH-4 was a light utility helicopter produced in Japan in the 1960s as a development of the Bell 47 that Kawasaki had been building under licence since 1952.

title: Kawasaki KH-4
text: The most visible difference between the KH-4 and its forerunner was its new and enlarged cabin.

title: Kawasaki KH-4
text: This was fully enclosed (although the side doors were removable) and provided seating for three passengers side-by-side on a bench seat behind the pilot's seat.

title: Kawasaki KH-4
text: The helicopter was provided with a new control system, revised instrumentation, and larger fuel tank.

title: Agusta-Bell AB.102
text: The Agusta AB.102 was an Italian helicopter produced in small numbers in the early 1960s.

title: Agusta-Bell AB.102
text: The aircraft was based on the mechanical components of a Bell 48 that Agusta incorporated into an all-new, streamlined fuselage.

title: Agusta-Bell AB.102
text: The first flight was on 3 February 1959 and the prototype was exhibited at that year's Paris Air Show in "faux" military colours.

title: Agusta-Bell AB.102
text: Only two production examples were built, operated by Elivie in a regular air service between Turin and Milan from 1961.

title: Agusta-Bell AB.102
text: However, the advent of turbine-powered helicopters in the 1960s soon rendered the AB.102 obsolete.

title: American Aircraft Penetrator
text: The American Aircraft Penetrator, now referred as the Aerocraft Stealth Star 204 SS, was a gunship helicopter modified from the Bell UH-1B Iroquois with tandem seating for the pilots and a troop-carrying compartment.

title: Eurocopter EC135
text: The Eurocopter EC135 (now Airbus Helicopters H135) is a twin-engine civil light utility helicopter produced by Airbus Helicopters (formerly known as Eurocopter).

title: Eurocopter EC135
text: It is capable of flight under instrument flight rules (IFR) and is outfitted with digital flight controls.

title: Eurocopter EC135
text: It entered service in 1996; over a thousand aircraft have been produced to date.

title: Eurocopter EC135
text: It is widely used by police and ambulance services and for executive transport; by 2013, more than 500 EC135s were providing helicopter emergency medical services across the world.

title: Eurocopter EC135
text: While the EC135 is primarily used by civil operators, a combat-capable military-orientated variant of the EC135, designated as the Eurocopter EC635, has also been produced.

title: Robinson R44
text: The Robinson R44 is a four-seat light helicopter produced by Robinson Helicopter Company since 1992.

title: Robinson R44
text: Based on the company's two-seat Robinson R22, the R44 features hydraulically assisted flight controls.

title: Robinson R44
text: It was first flown on 31 March 1990 and received FAA certification in December 1992, with the first delivery in February 1993.

title: AAI Penetrator
text: The American Aircraft International Penetrator was a military helicopter prototype conceived in 1990 as a gunship conversion of the Bell UH-1 Iroquois, aimed at ground insertion, close support and counter-insurgency roles.

title: Brantly B-2
text: The Brantly B-2 is an American two-seat light helicopter produced by the Brantly Helicopter Corporation.

title: Nam Cheong Station
text: Nam Cheong () is a MTR interchange station located at ground level beneath West Kowloon Highway, in Sham Shui Po, Hong Kong opposite the Fu Cheong Estate.

title: Nam Cheong Station
text: It is served by the Tung Chung Line and West Rail Line and provides cross-platform interchange between platform 1 (West Rail Line towards Tuen Mun) and platform 4 (Tung Chung Line towards Hong Kong).

title: Nam Cheong Station
text: The livery of Nam Cheong Station is pale yellow green.

title: Mei Foo Station
text: Mei Foo () is a Hong Kong MTR station located in Mei Foo Sun Chuen, Lai Chi Kok, New Kowloon.

title: Mei Foo Station
text: It is an interchange station between the Tsuen Wan Line and the West Rail Line, situated between Lai Chi Kok and Lai King stations on the Tsuen Wan Line and Nam Cheong Station and Tsuen Wan West stations on the West Rail Line.

title: Mei Foo Station
text: Mei Foo Station's livery is blue.

title: Yuen Long Station
text: Yuen Long () is an MTR station located in the northeastern part of Yuen Long Town, Yuen Long District, between Kam Sheung Road and Long Ping stations on the West Rail Line.

title: Yuen Long Station
text: It is an interchange between the West Rail Line and the Light Rail Yuen Long Stop.

title: West Rail Line
text: The West Rail Line () is one of the MTR lines in Hong Kong, indicated by the colour dark magenta.

title: West Rail Line
text: It was formerly known as the KCR West Rail (九廣西鐵 ).

title: West Rail Line
text: The line connects Hung Hom Station in Kowloon and Tuen Mun Station in Tuen Mun, 35.7 km away, in 37 minutes.

title: West Rail Line
text: The railway runs through the cities of Kowloon, Castle Peak and Tsuen Wan.

title: East Rail Line
text: The East Rail Line () is one of eleven railway lines of the Mass Transit Railway (MTR) system in Hong Kong.

title: East Rail Line
text: It used to be one of the three lines of the Kowloon–Canton Railway (KCR) network.

title: East Rail Line
text: It was known as the KCR British Section (九廣鐵路英段) from 1910 to 1996, and the KCR East Rail (九廣東鐵) from 1996 to 2007.

title: East Rail Line
text: The East Rail was the only railway line of the Kowloon-Canton Railway Corporation (KCRC) before the construction of "KCR West Rail" (now known as West Rail Line).

title: Canton Road Station
text: Canton Road Station (Trad.

title: Canton Road Station
text: Chinese: 廣東道站) was a planned railway station on the Kowloon Southern Link of West Rail Line between East Tsim Sha Tsui Station and Austin Station, beneath the shopping mall, Harbour City in Tsim Sha Tsui, by replacing the existing underground car park.

title: Canton Road Station
text: But it was never to be built because of the failed negotiations between the Kowloon-Canton Railway Corporation (KCRC), the former developer of the station, and The Wharf (Holdings) Limited, the owner of the Harbour City.

title: Austin Station (MTR)
text: Austin () is an underground MTR rapid transit station on the West Rail Line in Hong Kong, situated perpendicular to Wui Cheung Road and Austin Road West, and formerly adjacent to Jordan Road Ferry Pier Bus Terminus.

title: Austin Station (MTR)
text: It is the only intermediate station along the Kowloon Southern Link project, built to connect the West Rail Line and East Rail Line.

title: Austin Station (MTR)
text: Construction was finished in July 2009 and the station opened on 16 August 2009.

title: Tuen Mun South Extension
text: Tuen Mun South Extension is a proposed extension of the West Rail Line to the Tuen Mun South () station in the vicinities of Tuen Mun Ferry Pier.

title: Tuen Mun South Extension
text: This station will serve as the future West Rail Line westbound terminus if built.

title: Tuen Mun South Extension
text: The extension will extend southwards from the current western terminus Tuen Mun Station.

title: Tuen Mun South Extension
text: The journey time from Tuen Mun South to Tuen Mun is estimated to be approximately 4 minutes.

title: Tuen Mun South Extension
text: It is planned to run on viaduct, since if it were to continue underground the gradient would be too steep for the trains to run through.

title: Kowloon Southern Link
text: The Kowloon Southern Link is a section of the MTR West Rail Line, linking Nam Cheong Station and East Tsim Sha Tsui Station.

title: Kowloon Southern Link
text: The rail link is fully underground, lies along the south-west coastline of Kowloon Peninsula, east of rail tracks of the Tung Chung Line and Airport Express.

title: Kowloon Southern Link
text: Kowloon Southern Link has one underground intermediate station called Austin Station (formerly West Kowloon Station).

title: Kowloon Southern Link
text: It is located adjacent to the Canton Road Government Offices, close to Kowloon Station of Tung Chung Line and Airport Express.

title: Kowloon Southern Link
text: However, the structures do not provide a direct transfer between the two stations.

title: Harbour City (Hong Kong)
text: Harbour City is a large shopping mall in Tsim Sha Tsui, Hong Kong.

title: Harbour City (Hong Kong)
text: It is part of a series of office blocks and hotels.

title: Harbour City (Hong Kong)
text: It comprises several parts: Marco Polo Hong Kong Hotel, Ocean Terminal, Ocean Centre (with 1980s retro decor), the Gateway and the Pacific Club Kowloon.

title: Harbour City (Hong Kong)
text: The complex is located along the west side of Canton Road, stretching from the Star Ferry Pier in the south to China Hong Kong City in the north.

title: The Sound of Your Heart (TV series)
text: The Sound Of Your Heart (Hangul: 마음의 소리 / RR: Maeumui Sori) is a South Korean sitcom starring Lee Kwang-soo and Jung So-min.

title: The Sound of Your Heart (TV series)
text: The sitcom is based on the Webtoon "The Sound of Heart."

title: The Sound of Your Heart (TV series)
text: The first 10 episodes were aired as a web series on November 7, 2016 through Naver TV Cast on Mondays at 6:00 (KST), and the remaining 10 episodes aired from December 2016.

title: The Sound of Your Heart (TV series)
text: The web series hit 100 million views on Sohu TV and ranked No. 1 among Korean dramas on the site.

title: The Sound of Your Heart (TV series)
text: On Naver TV Cast, the web series has more than 40 million views in South Korea as of February 2017.

title: The Sound of Your Heart (TV series)
text: It is also now airing on Netflix.

title: Lina (South Korean singer)
text: Lee Ji-yeon (born February 18, 1984), better known by her stage name Lina is a South Korean singer and musical actress.

title: Lina (South Korean singer)
text: She debuted in 2002 as a member of South Korean R&B duo Isak N Jiyeon and disbanded in 2004.

title: Lina (South Korean singer)
text: She later re-debut as a member of South Korean girl group The Grace in 2005 and the group currently being inactive.

title: Lina (South Korean singer)
text: She currently active as a musical actress.

title: Unstoppable Marriage (TV series)
text: Unstoppable Marriage () is a South Korean sitcom that aired on KBS2 from November 5, 2007 to May 30, 2008, on Mondays to Fridays at 18:50 for 140 episodes.

title: Unstoppable Marriage (TV series)
text: It was adapted from the 2007 South Korean film of the same name.

title: Taeyang
text: Dong Young-bae (; born 18 May 1988), better known by his stage name Taeyang (meaning "sun" in Korean) and SOL (when performing in Japan), is a South Korean singer, songwriter and dancer.

title: Taeyang
text: After appearing in Jinusean's music video "A-yo," Taeyang began training under YG Entertainment at the age of 12.

title: Taeyang
text: Six years later, he made his debut in 2006 as a member of the South Korean boy band Big Bang.

title: Taeyang
text: While the quintet's debut was met with lukewarm receptions, their follow-ups cemented their popularity, becoming one of the best-selling digital group of all-time in Asia and one of the best-selling boy bands in the world.

title: Sunmin
text: Sunmin (Hangul: 선민, "Katakana": ソンミン, born August 4, 1987) is a South Korean singer who speaks and sings in Korean, Japanese, and English.

title: Sunmin
text: She debuted in 2006, with the single "Keep Holding You," a collaboration with the Japanese R&B singer Toshinobu Kubota.

title: Sunmin
text: Her career was initially focused on the Japanese market, but her work became focused in South Korea from 2009 to 2010.

title: Sunmin
text: She also contributed to original soundtracks of South Korean television series "Master of Study" and "Gloria (2010 TV series)".

title: Sunmin
text: In 2010 to 2011, she was in the main South Korean musical production of "Jekyll & Hyde" as Lucy.

title: Sunmin
text: In 2012 to 2013, she reprised her role as Lucy in the South Korean national tour.

title: Sunmin
text: In spring 2013, Sunmin played Josephine in the South Korean production of "Arsène Lupin", the musical.

title: The Producers (TV series)
text: The Producers (; lit.

title: The Producers (TV series)
text: Producer) is a 2015 South Korean sitcom starring Cha Tae-hyun, Gong Hyo-jin, Kim Soo-hyun, and IU.

title: The Producers (TV series)
text: It aired on KBS2 from 15 May 2015 to 20 June 2015 on Fridays and Saturdays at 21:15 for 12 episodes.

title: IU (singer)
text: Lee Ji-eun (Korean: 이지은 ; born May 16, 1993), better known by her stage name IU (Korean: 아이유 ), is a South Korean singer, songwriter and actress.

title: IU (singer)
text: While still in middle school, IU auditioned for various talent agencies with ambitions of becoming a singer.

title: IU (singer)
text: She signed with LOEN Entertainment in 2007 as a trainee and began her music career at the age of 15 with her debut album, "Lost and Found".

title: IU (singer)
text: Her follow-up albums, "Growing Up" and "IU...IM", brought her mainstream success, but it was through "Good Day" (Korean: 좋은 날 ), the lead single from her 2010 album "Real", that she achieved national stardom.

title: IU (singer)
text: "Good Day" spent five consecutive weeks at the top position of South Korea's Gaon Digital Chart and holds the record for spending the most number of weeks at No. 1 along with Psy's "Gangnam Style".

title: Kwon So-hyun
text: Kwon So-hyun (born August 30, 1994), is a South Korean singer and actress.

title: Kwon So-hyun
text: She was known as a member of the South Korean girl group 4Minute, under Cube Entertainment.

title: Kwon So-hyun
text: She is also a former member of the South Korean girl group, Orange.

title: Kwon So-hyun
text: Before June 15, 2016 (end of her contract with Cube), Sohyun left 4Minute and the record label along with members Nam Ji-hyun, Heo Ga-yoon, and Jeon Ji-yoon.

title: Han Sun-hwa
text: Han Sun-hwa (born October 6, 1990), is a South Korean singer and actress.

title: Han Sun-hwa
text: She is a former member of the South Korean girl group Secret.

title: Han Sun-hwa
text: She made her television debut in 2004 while participating in SBS's "Superstar Survival" as a finalist, and in 2009, she was a regular cast on a variety show called "Invincible Youth".

title: Han Sun-hwa
text: Aside from music, she also ventured into acting and made her debut in the 2010 drama, "More Charming By The Day".

title: Han Sun-hwa
text: She also acted in several dramas with supporting roles in "Ad Genius Lee Tae-baek", "God's Gift - 14 Days", and "Marriage, Not Dating".

title: Han Sun-hwa
text: In 2014 she finally starred as a lead actress on MBC's weekend drama "Rosy Lovers" as Baek Jang Mi co-starring with actor Lee Jang Woo.

title: Han Sun-hwa
text: CNN International Seoul listed Sunhwa as one of the nine rising "It" stars in Korean entertainment citing her as a "multi-tasking" artist.

title: Han Sun-hwa
text: Her portrayal of Kang Se-Ah in the 2014 TVN drama, "Marriage, Not Dating" earned her a nomination for "Best Youth Actress" at the 16th Seoul International Youth Film Festival.

title: Han Sun-hwa
text: In 2014, her portrayal of Jang-Mi from "Rosy Lovers" and Jenny from "God's Gift 14 Day"s won her two best new actress awards from MBC and SBS Drama Awards.

title: Han Sun-hwa
text: It was confirmed on September 26, 2016 that Sunhwa had not renewed her contract with TS Entertainment and will officially part ways in October.

title: Han Sun-hwa
text: On October 14, 2016 Sunhwa joined Huayi Brothers as an actress.

title: Shinsadong Tiger
text: Lee Ho-yang (Korean: 이호양 ), better known by his stage name Shinsadong Tiger (Korean: 신사동호랭이 "Shinsadong Horaengi") is a South Korean music producer and songwriter.

title: Shinsadong Tiger
text: Even after debuting in 2001 at the age of 18 (19 in Korean age), he has worked many odd jobs to fund his music career.

title: Shinsadong Tiger
text: He has become a prominent figure in the Korean pop music industry and is responsible for a number of popular songs.

title: Shinsadong Tiger
text: In 2010, he was named the "New Generation Producer" at the 18th Korean Culture Entertainment Awards, and in 2011 he was named as one of the most influential figures in the South Korean music industry by OSEN.

title: Shinsadong Tiger
text: Lee has recently started his own label, AB Entertainment, in which he has debuted his own girl group named EXID.

title: Want Ads
text: "Want Ads" was a million-selling Number 1 pop and R&B hit recorded by female group, Honey Cone for their third album "Sweet Replies" and also appears on their fourth album "Soulful Tapestry".

title: Want Ads
text: The song on the Detroit-based Hot Wax label was written by Greg Perry, General Norman Johnson and Barney Perkins.

title: Want Ads
text: It was produced by staff producer, Greg Perry, and features a young Ray Parker, Jr. ("Ghostbusters") on rhythm guitar.

title: Ray Parker Jr.
text: Ray Erskine Parker Jr. (born May 1, 1954) is an American guitarist, singer-songwriter, record producer, and actor, best known for writing and performing the theme song to the movie "Ghostbusters", for his solo music, and for performing with his band, Raydio, and with Barry White.

title: Sex and the Single Man
text: Sex and the Single Man is third solo album by guitarist/singer/songwriter Ray Parker Jr. released in 1985 on the Arista label.

title: Sex and the Single Man
text: The record includes the singles "Girls Are More Fun" and "One Sided Love Affair".

title: Ghostbusters (song)
text: "Ghostbusters" is a song written and recorded by Ray Parker Jr. as the theme to the film of the same name starring Bill Murray, Dan Aykroyd, Harold Ramis, and Ernie Hudson.

title: Ghostbusters (song)
text: Debuting at #68 on June 16, 1984, the song reached number one on the "Billboard" Hot 100 on August 11, 1984, staying there for three weeks, and at number two on the UK Singles Chart on September 16, 1984, staying there for three weeks.

title: Ghostbusters (song)
text: The song re-entered the UK Top 75 on November 2, 2008, at No. 49.

title: The Other Woman (Ray Parker Jr. album)
text: The Other Woman is the debut solo album by guitarist/singer/songwriter Ray Parker Jr. released in 1982 on the Arista label.

title: The Other Woman (Ray Parker Jr. album)
text: The album was remastered and expanded by Funky Town Grooves in June 2012 including 3 bonus tracks.

title: I Still Can't Get Over Loving You
text: "I Still Can't Get Over Loving You" is a 1983 song written and performed by Ray Parker, Jr..

title: I Still Can't Get Over Loving You
text: It was the lead single from his "Woman Out of Control" album of the same year, and it reached number 12 on the "Billboard" Hot 100 in early 1984.

title: I Still Can't Get Over Loving You
text: It was Parker's fifth Top 20 hit, the sixth being 1984's "Ghostbusters".

title: Dan Aykroyd
text: Daniel Edward Aykroyd {'1': ", '2': ", '3': ", '4': "} (born July 1, 1952) is a Canadian-American actor, comedian, producer, screenwriter, musician and businessman.

title: Dan Aykroyd
text: He was an original member of the "Not Ready for Prime Time Players" on "Saturday Night Live" (1975–1979).

title: Dan Aykroyd
text: A musical sketch he performed with John Belushi on "SNL", The Blues Brothers, turned into an actual performing band and then a highly successful 1980 film, also called "The Blues Brothers".

title: Woman Out of Control
text: Woman Out of Control is second solo album by Ray Parker Jr. It was released in 1983 on the Arista label.

title: Woman Out of Control
text: The record includes the single "I Still Can't Get Over Loving You" which reached number 12 on the "Billboard" Hot 100 in early 1984.

title: Woman Out of Control
text: The album was remastered and expanded by Funky Town Grooves in June 2012.

title: After Dark (Ray Parker Jr. album)
text: After Dark is the fourth album by guitarist/singer/songwriter Ray Parker Jr. released in 1987 for the new Geffen Records label.

title: After Dark (Ray Parker Jr. album)
text: The record company released the album on August 25, 1987.

title: After Dark (Ray Parker Jr. album)
text: It included the single "I Don't Think That Man Should Sleep Alone".

title: Saturday Night Live cast members
text: The following is a list of "Saturday Night Live" cast members, past and present.

title: Saturday Night Live cast members
text: The cast members of "Saturday Night Live" were originally referred to as the "Not Ready For Prime Time Players."

title: Lowell Smith
text: Lowell Herbert Smith (October 8, 1892—November 4, 1945) was a pioneer American airman who piloted the first airplane to receive a complete mid-air refueling (along with Lt. John P.
